title: Letter: Animal lover's advice to richest man in Florida
text:
I read with alarm Jemima Kelly's magazine piece “In the court of Mar-a-Lago” (Life & Arts, November 26) and her description of what happened to the beautiful iguana shot by Thomas Peterffy, one of the “Trumpette” members of Mar-a-Lago, Donald Trump's private club and the former president's primary residence.

I would like to invite “the richest man in Florida” — as Peterffy is described by Kelly — to make a significant donation to Nature Conservancy or World Wildlife Fund — and to get a copy of Joel Sartore's The Photo Ark and look into the eyes of his compelling portraits of animals.

Then, the next time he crosses paths with an iguana, maybe he can grab his iPhone and take a photo of its face — or better yet, give it a name.

Elizabeth Hammond
Nevada City, CA, US
